I’m going down the docker-install route and followed the docker instructions last night \(and the setup went smoothly\). When I run the test simulation command \(\`ign launch virtual\_stix.ign -v 4\`\) things are a bit off, and the first thing that I’ve noticed is that the /clock topic is incorrect: there are two distinct clock streams being published together, with one about 1500 seconds ahead of the other. This is causing many a cascade of other problems.

I suspect this would probably also happen in the native build.

To recreate, just echo the `/clock` topic in another shell joined onto the running ignition instance. A `rostopic info /clock` shows me that only the `ros1_ign_bridge` node is publishing the /clock topic.
